# The Last Library Book

Marion had worked at the library for forty years. On her final day, she found a book wedged behind the radiator in the children's sectionâprobably there for decades.

It was a thin volume called "The Cloud Keeper," never checked out according to the card in back. The due date slip was blank.

results.text_content:
# The Last Leaf

On a quiet street, an old oak tree stood between two apartment buildings. Every autumn, a little girl named Maya would watch its leaves turn gold and fall.

One November, only a single leaf remained. Maya, now bedridden with illness, could see it from her window.

"When that leaf falls," she whispered to her grandmother, "I'll be gone too."

Her grandmother smiled softly but said nothing.

Days passed. Wind howled. Rain poured. Yet the leaf clung stubbornly to its branch.

# The Last Leaf

On a cold autumn morning, Emma found a tiny bird shivering on her doorstep, too weak to fly south with the others.

She brought it inside, made a nest from an old scarf, and fed it seeds and water. Each day, the bird grew stronger, hopping around her small apartment and perching on her shoulder while she read.

As winter arrived, Emma worried. "You missed your chance to migrate," she whispered sadly.
